#summary public function checkOut($folder = '/', $outPath = '.')
#labels Function-Reference,Language-EN

= checkOut =

This method uses [getDirectoryTree] to retrieve the specified $folder from the latest version, and save its hierarchy to $outPath.  The $folder prefix is not carried over to the local filesystem; its contents will appear directly in $outPath.

    * @param string $folder Folder to checkout.
    * @param integer $outPath Local path where the contents of $folder will go.
    * @return void This function doesn't return anything.

= Usage =

{{{
checkOut($svnDir, $localDir);
}}}

= Example =
Copy the contents of the `trunk` directory to `/tmp` (Linux directory where files eventually get cleaned out).

{{{
$url = 'http://phpsvnclient.googlecode.com/svn/';

require_once("phpsvnclient.php");
$phpsvnclient = new phpsvnclient($url);

$phpsvnclient->checkOut('trunk', '/tmp');
}}}
